hosting_multisite_git_association_title: Configure your Git for your {{ path }} directory
hosting_multisite_git_association_incorr: The URL format is not correct.
hosting_multisite_git_association_ssh_ur: Enter the URL of your Git repository ({{ httpsRepo }}), or specify if SSH is enabled ({{ sshRepo }})
hosting_multisite_git_association_ssh_ke: Unable to generate your SSH key. Please try again later or contact support
hosting_multisite_git_association_apply_: Your last configuration was unsuccessful. In order to configure Git, you will need to reapply your configuration.
hosting_multisite_git_association_error_: Git could not be enabled {{ errorMessage }}
hosting_multisite_git_association_succes: Enabling Git... You can track Git activation progress in Current tasks
hosting_multisite_git_association_ssh_br: Enter the name of the repository branch you want to replicate ({{ branchesNames }})
hosting_multisite_git_association_config: Configure the deployment of your files on your Git repository
Enter your Git repository URL and branch name:
HTTPS for a public repository (e.g.: https://github.com/username/)
SSH for a private repository (e.g.: git@github.com:username/)
The installation directory must be empty;
Before applying the configuration, you need to add your new SSH key to your Git account settings in order to deploy a private repository.
hosting_multisite_git_association_webhoo: A webhook is a tool that allows Github to send updates to other applications, notifying them of specific events occurring in a Github repository.
hosting_multisite_git_association_config: Your configuration will apply to all domains pointing to your directory.
hosting_multisite_git_association_reconf: You will need to redeploy your branch for the changes to take effect
Repository URL cannot be changed. To deploy another repository to this directory, you have to first delete and recreate the git configuration linked to this directory.
